name: treatment of used refrigerant R134a, venting | used refrigerant R134a | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14065/documentation

This dataset represent treatment of used refrigerant R134a by venting.;The refrigerant R134a is widely used refrigerant (mainly in automobile air conditioning systems and othere refrigeration and cooling technologies). It can be treated by primary three different technologies; 1) venting, 2) reclamation and 3) final disposal. ;Since the R134a causes global warming venting as a way of treatment is forbidden in some countries. For example in the US (US EPA, http://www.epa.gov/ozone/title6/608/faq.html, accessed 20141105).

The activity starts, when the used refrigerant is accepted for treatment.

No energy is used during this process.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Venting is simple releasing of the R134a refrigerant to air. This treatment is forbidden in some countries due to R134a global warming potential.

flow.name: used refrigerant R134a
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

exchanges.description:
Calculated value.

It is assumed, that all the refrigerant is vented into air.
